title: Royal Jordanian plans 18 narrow body jet order: CEO
text:
FILE PHOTO: A traveler walks past a sign for Royal Jordanian airline at JFK International Airport in New York, U.S., March 21, 2017. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson/File Photo

DUBAI (Reuters) - Royal Jordanian RJAL.AM has decided on an order for 18 narrow body jets, the Middle East airline’s chief executive told Reuters on Monday.

The aircraft order is waiting for board approval, expected later this month, Chief Executive Stefan Pichler told Reuters on the sidelines of an aviation conference in Dubai.

He declined to provide details on which company the order would be placed with.

The Amman-based carrier expects to carry 3.5 million passengers this year, he said.
description: Royal Jordanian has decided on an order for 18 narrow body jets, the Middle East airline's chief executive told Reuters on Monday.
